title: Git Revert
mainDescription: It is one of the most safest commands out there.
Unlike rebase which modifies git history, revert always creates a new commit object.
Consider the example below, if we want to revert the last commit, we would do <-- git revert 66cc41f -->.
This would revert the changes and would be considered as a new commit. If any conflicts are present, git will prompt for resolution.
postDescription: As you can see the head is now moved to 1be721c , which is the new reversal commit.
